title: Sacroiliac Joint Dysfunction Management
content: Sacroiliac joint dysfunction presents with low back and buttock pain. Treatment includes manual therapy techniques to address joint hypomobility or hypermobility, specific stabilization exercises, and temporary support with sacroiliac belts. Corticosteroid injection under fluoroscopic or ultrasound guidance confirms diagnosis and provides therapeutic benefit. Radiofrequency denervation or minimally invasive fusion may be considered for refractory cases.
